perturbation.original_text:
This Non-Exclusive Distributor Agreement (the “Agreement”) is made and entered into as of this 19th day of July 2018, by
and between iMine Corporation, (hereinafter referred to as “JRVS”) and SUNWAI Technology, a Taiwanese company, with its
principal office at 6th Floor, No. 258, Section 3, Nanjing East Road, Songshan District, Taipei 10051 (hereinafter referred to as the
“Distributor”).
perturbation.changed_text:
This Non-Exclusive Distributor Agreement (the “Agreement”) is made and entered into as of this 19th day of July 2018, by
and between iMine Corporation, (hereinafter referred to as “JRVS”) and SUNWAI Technology, a Taiwanese company, with its
principal office at 6th Floor, No. 258, Section 3, Nanjing East Road, Songshan District, Taipei 10051 (hereinafter referred to as the
“Vendor”).
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Vendor'. This creates a contradiction, as later sections refer to the original term Distributor, and it's not consistently changed, making it unclear if Distributor and Vendor are the same.

perturbation.original_text:
1.7 “Products” shall mean the products offered by JRVS for sale to the Distributor; the Products shall include iMine
cryptocurrency mining rigs and its parts and components.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.7 “Products” shall mean the goods offered by JRVS for sale to the Distributor; the Products shall include iMine
cryptocurrency mining rigs and its parts and components.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'products' to 'goods' in the definition creates ambiguity. While they might seem interchangeable, legal interpretations could differ, especially if 'goods' has a specific definition elsewhere or under applicable law, while other sections keep using the term Products. This creates uncertainty about the scope of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
10.1 Sole Warranty. THE SOLE WARRANTY, IF ANY, PROVIDED IN CONNECTION WITH THE PRODUCT SHALL BE
PROVIDED BY THE COMPONENT MANUFACTURER. JRVS MAKES NO WARRANTIES TO THE DISTRIBUTOR OR
CUSTOMERS.
10.2 Warranty Period. JRVS shall NOT provide a warranty of any kind for each of the Products against defects in material
and workmanship under normal use and service from the date of delivery to the Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.1 Sole Warranty. THE SOLE WARRANTY, IF ANY, PROVIDED IN CONNECTION WITH THE GOODS SHALL BE
PROVIDED BY THE COMPONENT MANUFACTURER. JRVS MAKES NO WARRANTIES TO THE DISTRIBUTOR OR
CUSTOMERS.
10.2 Warranty Period. JRVS shall NOT provide a warranty of any kind for each of the Products against defects in material
and workmanship under normal use and service from the date of delivery to the Reseller.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Reseller' in section 10.2 introduces another ambiguity. It's now unclear if 'Distributor' and 'Reseller' refer to the same entity, especially considering the warranty terms. The document does not state they're interchangeable, creating uncertainty about who the warranty applies to and whether the Distributor is also considered the Reseller for warranty purposes.
